# ix-category-filter

props.name: categories
props.docs:
Configuration object hash used to populate the dropwdown menu for typeahead and quick selection functionality.
Each ID maps to an object with a label and an array of options to select from.

props.name: filterState
props.docs: A set of search criteria to populate the component with.

props.name: hideIcon
props.docs:
Allows to hide the icon inside the text input.
Defaults to false

props.name: icon
props.docs:
The icon next to the actual text input
Defaults to 'search'

props.name: initialState
props.docs:
When set this will initially populate the component with the provided search criteria.
This will trigger all input events accordingly.

docsTags.name: deprecated
docsTags.text: Will be removed with 2.0.0. Use the member filterState instead.

props.deprecation: Will be removed with 2.0.0. Use the member filterState instead.

props.name: nonSelectableCategories
props.docs:
In certain use cases some categories are not available for selection any more.
To allow proper display of set filters with these categories this ID to label mapping can be populated.
Configuration object hash used to supply labels to the filter chips in the input field.
Each ID maps to a string representing the label to display.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Placeholder text to be displayed in an empty input field.

props.name: repeatCategories
props.docs:
If set to true allows that a single category can be set more than once.
An already set category will not appear in the category dropdown if set to false.

Defaults to true

props.name: suggestions
props.docs: A list of strings that will be supplied as typeahead suggestions not tied to any categories.

events.docs: Event dispatched whenever the filter state changes.
Event dispatched whenever the text input changes.

# ix-date-picker

props.name: eventDelimiter
props.docs:
Default behavior of the done event is to join the two events (date and time) into one combined string output.
This combination can be configured over the delimiter

props.name: format
props.docs:
Date format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: from
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the start date.

Format is based on `format`

props.name: maxDate
props.docs:
The latest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: minDate
props.docs:
The earliest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: range
props.docs: If true a range of dates can be selected.

props.name: to
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the end date.
If the picker is not in range mode leave this value `null`

Format is based on `format`

methods.name: getCurrentDate
methods.signature: getCurrentDate() => Promise<{ start: string; end: string; }>

events.docs:
Date change event

If datepicker is in range mode the event detail will be sperated with a `-` e.g.
`2022/10/22 - 2022/10/24` (start and end). If range mode is choosen consider to use `dateRangeChange`.

docsTags.name: depracted
docsTags.text: String output will be removed. Set ´doneEventDelimiter´ to undefined or null to get date change object instead of a string

events.docs:
Date range change.
Only triggered if datepicker is in range mode
Date selection confirmed via button action
Date selection confirmed via button action

# ix-datetime-picker

props.name: dateFormat
props.docs:
Date format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: eventDelimiter
props.docs:
Default behavior of the done event is to join the two events (date and time) into one combined string output.
This combination can be configured over the delimiter

props.name: from
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the start date.

Format is based on `format`

props.name: maxDate
props.docs:
The latest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: minDate
props.docs:
The earliest date that can be selected by the date picker.
If not set there will be no restriction.

props.name: showTimeReference
props.docs:
Show time reference input
Time reference is default aligned with @see {this.timeFormat}

props.name: timeFormat
props.docs:
Time format string.
See @link https://moment.github.io/luxon/#/formatting?id=table-of-tokens for all available tokens.

props.name: to
props.docs:
Picker date. If the picker is in range mode this property is the end date.
If the picker is not in range mode leave this value `null`

Format is based on `format`

events.docs: Date selection event is fired after confirm button is pressend

Done event

Set `doneEventDelimiter` to null or undefine to get the typed event

# ix-event-list

props.name: animated
props.docs: Animate state change transitions. Defaults to 'true'.

props.name: chevron
props.docs: Display a chevron icon in list items. Defaults to 'false'

props.name: itemHeight
props.docs:
Determines the height of list items.
This can either be one of two predefined sizes ('S' or 'L') or an absolute pixel value.
In case a number is supplied it will get converted to rem internally.
Defaults to 'S'.

# ix-upload

props.name: accept
props.docs:
The accept attribute specifies the types of files that the server accepts (that can be submitted through a file upload).
[accept]{@link "https://www.w3schools.com/tags/att_input_accept.asp"}

props.name: loadingText
props.docs: Will be used by state = UploadFileState.LOADING

props.name: multiline
props.docs: Whether the text should wrap to more than one line

props.name: multiple
props.docs: If multiple is true the user can drop or select multiple files

props.name: selectFileText
props.docs: Will be used by state = UploadFileState.SELECT_FILE

props.name: state
props.docs: After a file is uploaded you can set the upload component to a defined state

props.name: uploadFailedText
props.docs: Will be used by state = UploadFileState.UPLOAD_FAILED

props.name: uploadSuccessText
props.docs: Will be used by state = UploadFileState.UPLOAD_SUCCESSED

events.docs: You get an array of Files after drop-action or browse action is finished
